name: Slider
classJavaDoc:
Test for a horizontal slider.
 *
 * Slider parts:
 * * full edge
 * * full gauge
 * * slider knob
 * * empty gauge
 * * empty edge
 * * maybe more/less buttons
 * * maybe some textual representation of the progress. The text can be
 * ** int the full gauge
 * ** in the empty gauge
 * ** in the knob
 * ** somewhere outside of the slider
 *
 *

name: CircleComponent
classJavaDoc: * Provides a circle shape for rendering.

methods.name: fill
methods.documentation: sets whether the circle should be filled or just an outline.

methods.name: getRadius
methods.documentation: returns the radius of the circle

methods.name: setRadius
methods.documentation: sets the radius of the circle

methods.name: getSize
methods.documentation: returns the rectangular size of the circle

methods.name: getFill
methods.documentation: returns true when the circle should be filled

methods.name: setFill
methods.documentation: sets whether the circle should be filled or not

methods.name: circle
methods.documentation: creates a circle

methods.name: fill
methods.documentation: sets whether the rectangle should be drawn filled or as a wireframe.

methods.name: getSize
methods.documentation: Returns the size of the rectangle

methods.name: setSize
methods.documentation: Sets the size of the rectangle. Note that this forces recalculation of the transformation matrix.

methods.name: getFill
methods.documentation: Returns whether the rectangle should be filled or not.

methods.name: setFill
methods.documentation: Sets whether the rectangle should be filled or not.

methods.name: rect
methods.documentation: creates a new rect component

name: ColorComponent
classJavaDoc: * Component to supply color to other drawing components.

methods.name: getColor
methods.documentation: returns the color

methods.name: setColor
methods.documentation: sets the color

methods.name: color
methods.documentation: creates a color component from red, green and blue color components

methods.name: color
methods.documentation: creates a color component from a color

name: Label
classJavaDoc:
* Simple text based label. The labels content is updated each frame from the supplier. *

* Usage: *

* ``` * game.addChild(new Label(, , () -> "text to be displayed")); * ```

name: Rotate3dComponent
classJavaDoc: * Rotate the game object and all child objects in 3d.

methods.name: getRotateX
methods.documentation: Returns the x angle of the rotation

methods.name: setRotateX
methods.documentation: Sets the x angle of the rotation

methods.name: getRotateY
methods.documentation: Returns the y angle of the rotation

methods.name: setRotateY
methods.documentation: Sets the y angle of the rotation

methods.name: getRotateZ
methods.documentation: Returns the z angle of the rotation

methods.name: setRotateZ
methods.documentation: Sets the x angle of the rotation

methods.name: getRotationMatrix
methods.documentation: Returns the rotation matrix

methods.name: rotate
methods.documentation: Create rotation component with no initial rotation.

methods.name: rotate
methods.documentation: Create rotation component with initial rotation around the euler angles.

methods.name: rotate
methods.documentation: Create rotation component with initial rotation described by the quaternion.

name: RotateComponent
classJavaDoc: * Rotate the game object and all child objects around the z axis.

methods.name: getAngle
methods.documentation: Returns the angle of the rotation

methods.name: setAngle
methods.documentation: Sets the angle of the rotation

methods.name: getRotationMatrix
methods.documentation: Returns the rotation matrix.

methods.name: rotate
methods.documentation: Creates a new rotation component with an initial angle.

name: OrbitComponent
classJavaDoc: changes the position of the game object so it orbits its parent.

name: LayerComponent
classJavaDoc: * Component to place the object in a specific render layer.

methods.name: getLayer
methods.documentation: returns the layer

methods.name: layer
methods.documentation: creates a component with a specifoc layer

methods.name: square
methods.documentation: when called the button is always square.

methods.name: neutral
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is neither hovered nor armed nor pressed.

methods.name: neutral
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is neither hovered nor armed nor pressed.

methods.name: hover
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is hovered

methods.name: hover
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is hovered

methods.name: armed
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is armed

methods.name: armed
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is armed

methods.name: pressed
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is pressed.

methods.name: pressed
methods.documentation: Sets the game object (components) which is used when the button is pressed.

methods.name: slice9
methods.documentation:
Adds .
TODO: unused at the moment.

methods.name: pushButton
methods.documentation:
Creates a new push button. The button can be pressed and is released when the mouse button is released.
Note that the "pressed" component is not used in this button type.

methods.name: toggleButton
methods.documentation:
Creates a new toggle button. The button can be pressed and is on the "pressed" state. Pressing the button
again moves the button in the neutral state again.

methods.name: button
methods.documentation: Creates a new button.

name: MouseComponent
classJavaDoc:
* Component to supply hoverEnter and hoverLeave events and drag events.
 * Note: needs "area" component so the component can check if the mouse cursor is over this game object

methods.name: isHovered
methods.documentation: Returns if the mouse cursor is over the component (hovered).

methods.name: emitDragFinishEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the dragging of the object is finished.

methods.name: emitMouseClickEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the mouse button is pressed and released over the game object.

methods.name: emitMouseReleaseEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the mouse button is released.

methods.name: emitMousePressEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the mouse button is pressed down.

methods.name: emitDraggingEvent
methods.documentation: Fired each frame the mouse is moved and the dragging operation is active.

methods.name: emitDragStartEvent
methods.documentation: Fired then the game object dragging is started.

methods.name: emitHoverEvent
methods.documentation: Fired then the mouse is hovered over the object. Note that there may also be be a mouse press and/or a dragging operation.

methods.name: emitHoverLeaveEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the mouse cursor leaves the bounding box of the game object.

methods.name: emitHoverEnterEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the mouse cursor enters the bounding box of the game object.

methods.name: mouse
methods.documentation: creates a new mouse() component.

name: PosComponent
classJavaDoc: * Adds a position vector to the Game Object.

methods.name: getTransform
methods.documentation: Returns the transformation matrix.

methods.name: getPos
methods.documentation: Returns the current position.

methods.name: setPos
methods.documentation: Sets the current position. Note that this will force recalculation of the transformation matrix.

methods.name: moveAction
methods.documentation:
Moves the position by a delta, respecting the frame time. So the delta is interpreted
as movement per second.

methods.name: moveByAction
methods.documentation: Moves the position by a delta. This action does ignore the frame time.

methods.name: move
methods.documentation: Moves the vector pos by amount amount

methods.name: slice9
methods.documentation: Creates a new slice9 sprite

name: AreaComponent
classJavaDoc:
* # AreaComponent *

* {@link AreaComponent#area()} provides collision detection for the game object.

methods.name: scale
methods.documentation: Scales the collision area by this factor.

methods.name: ignoreCollisionWith
methods.documentation: Sets the tags which should be ignored in collision detection.

methods.name: getLocalArea
methods.documentation: Returns collider area in local coordinates.

methods.name: getCollisionIgnore
methods.documentation: Returns the set of tags which should be ignored when doing collision checks.

methods.name: isColliding
methods.documentation: Returns true when this game object is colliding with anything this frame.

methods.name: getCollisions
methods.documentation: Returns current collisions.

methods.name: isCollidingWith
methods.documentation: Checks if this GameObject is colliding with `other` in this frame.

methods.name: emitCollideEvent
methods.documentation: Fired each frame for each collision of this object.

methods.name: emitCollideEndEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when a collection ended this frame.

methods.name: area
methods.documentation: Creates an area component without a collision shape.

methods.name: area
methods.documentation: Creates an area component without a rectangular collision shape.

name: TextComponent
classJavaDoc: * Component which displays some fixed text.

methods.name: setText
methods.documentation:
Sets the text which should be drawn. Note that this may change the size of the object
and therefore force recalculation of the transformation matrix.

methods.name: getText
methods.documentation: Returns the text which should be drawn.

methods.name: getFontHeight
methods.documentation: Returns the font height.

methods.name: setFontHeight
methods.documentation:
Sets the font height. Note that this may change the size of the object
and therefore force recalculation of the transformation matrix.

methods.name: getSize
methods.documentation: Returns the size of the component.

methods.name: text
methods.documentation: Creates a text component with fixed initial text.

name: AnchorComponent
classJavaDoc: * {@link AnchorComponent#anchor(AnchorType)} provides an anchor point for rendering shapes.

methods.name: getAnchor
methods.documentation: Returns the current anchor type.

methods.name: setAnchor
methods.documentation: Sets the current anchor type.

methods.name: anchor
methods.documentation: Creates a new anchor component.

name: BodyComponent
classJavaDoc: * Adds physics and collision detection to an object.

methods.name: isGrounded
methods.documentation: Returns true when the object is standing on another.

methods.name: isStatic
methods.documentation: Returns true when the object is static and cannot move.

methods.name: isFalling
methods.documentation: Returns true when the object is falling (moving down in direction of gravity).

methods.name: isJumping
methods.documentation: Returns true when the object is jumping (moving up in direction of gravity).

methods.name: jump
methods.documentation: Adds a jump force to the object.

methods.name: emitPhisicsResolveEvent
methods.documentation: Fired then the collision is resolved. Note: the event is fired for both parties of the collision.

methods.name: emitBeforePhysicsResolve
methods.documentation:
Fired just before the collision is tried to be resolved so interested parties can resolve the collision themselves.
Note: the event is fired for both parties of the collision.

methods.name: getLocalCoordinateDisplacement
methods.documentation: Calculate the displacement in the objects local coordinate system.

methods.name: emitHeadbuttEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the object is jumping an be just under another object.

methods.name: emitGroundEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the object is falling and landing just above another object.

methods.name: update
methods.documentation:
Params:

- float deltaTime

methods.name: emitFallEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the object is falling.

methods.name: emitFallOffEvent
methods.documentation: Fired when the object was standing on a plattform ({@link #emitGroundEvent(GameObject)}) and is falling again.

methods.name: body
methods.documentation: Creates a body component.

name: ScaleComponent
classJavaDoc:
* Scales the game object and all children by a factor. Note that in 2d stack the
 * z factor must be 1.0

methods.name: getScale
methods.documentation: Returns the scale factors for each axis.

methods.name: setScale
methods.documentation: Sets the scale factors for each axis.

methods.name: scale
methods.documentation: Creates a scale component with equal scale factor in x and y axis and a scale of 1.0 in z axis.

methods.name: scale
methods.documentation: Creates a scale component with initial factors in each axis.
